Description:
What motivates you? Is it power? Money? Respect? Or perhaps an insatiable craving for more, an unquenchable thirst that drives you relentlessly forward? Your race has built towering empires, conquered nations, and endured catastrophic collapses. Humans, embodying the duality of their nature, have proven themselves to be both the paragons of leadership and the epitomes of tyranny.
For every human, there exists an inherent aspiration for more. They yearn to leave the familiar confines of their towns and embark on grand adventures, driven by a potent mixture of thrill-seeking and the allure of promised rewards. No mountain stands too tall, no ocean runs too deep, and no desert presents an insurmountable challenge to these innate explorers. Humans possess an innate ability to multitask, deftly juggling myriad responsibilities, and they possess a sharp acumen for swiftly and efficiently solving problems.
The origin of the humans remains shrouded in mystery. Among the younger races, they burst forth seemingly out of nowhere, establishing themselves as a force to be reckoned with. Humans make formidable allies when befriended, their adaptability and resourcefulness shining through. However, one must exercise caution, for their unpredictable nature can transform them into formidable adversaries when antagonized. The humans, a complex and ever-evolving race, carry within them the potential for greatness or darkness, and their story continues to unfold across the realms, leaving an indelible mark wherever they tread.

~Proficiency in Persuasion~.Effect: Add your Level to all Checks for persuading people non-agressively (convincing them through dialogue).

~Proficiency in General Knowledge~.Effect: Add your Level to all Intelligence Checks for knowing various simple facts about science, astronomy, trades, etc.

Language: You speak Common and a number of languages of choice equal to your Intelligence.

~Human Vigilence~.Effect: Whenever you make a Check (before the roll), instead of rolling, you can automatically take the number 5 for the die (as if you rolled 5) for that Check.

~Talented~.Effect: You start with Training in any 2 Weapon Categories or Proficiencies (or one of each).
~Talented~.Notes: The 5 Weapon Categories are 1-Handed Melee Weapons, 2-Handed Melee Weapons, 1-Handed Ranged Weapons, 2-Handed Ranged Weapons, and Shields.

~Human Diversity~.Effect:
Choose any other Race (except Davel).
Gain one of its Racial Feats.
~Human Diversity~.Notes: Go to that Race's page and look for its Racial Feats list. You can't pick one that upgrades an Ability you don't have (e.g. an upgrade to Dragon's Breath).

Starting Abilities Description.Humans:
Humans are among the most consistent of the races and their concentration and mental resilience make them able to constantly succeed at menial tasks.
Human Vigilence also works for Resist Checks. But use it carefully - if you don't match the Spell Grade, you will fail automatically if you choose to take 4 instead of rolling!

Starting Abilities Description.Human Diversity:
There are several interesting starting Abilities you can choose from as a Human.
You can make yourself immune to Slows through the Bertle Ability, get more Reserve Health from Dwarves, a Spell from Elves.
You could see in the dark like the Gnomes, detect living Units like the Hollows or use Might instead of Dexterity with any weapon!

Starting Abilities Description.Talented:
Humans start with Training in any 2 Weapon Categories (1-Handed Melee, 2-Handed Melee, 1-Handed Ranged, 2-Handed Ranged and Shields).
Check the Weapons page to see all the weapon categories!

~Social Talent~.Effect: Your Charisma increases by +1 (up to +3), your Charisma Resist Checks by an extra +1 and you can understand the intent, tonality or general idea of written texts and spoken phrases in any language you don't speak.

~Magic Diversity~.Effect: Pick either Arcane, Eldritch or Divine, and you can also Know Abilities from that Ability List, on top of the Ability Lists from your Class.

~Ignorance Bliss~.Effect:
In Abilities that use Sense, Intelligence or Charisma, you can use the number 3 instead.
If your Spell Grade is less than 9, it becomes 9.
You gain Proficiency in Luck.
~Ignorance Bliss~.Notes: E.g. Chilling Shout becomes 12 + your Dexterity instead of 12 + 3. Phase Orb becomes 2d6 + 3 + 3 instead of 2d6 + Intelligence + Charisma.
